Text: Re TW outageyour request Jan Forwarded by Jan CobdenETSEnron on AM David L Johnson AM To Louis SoldanoETSEnron cc Subject Re TW outage Louie Couple of comments Its the New Mexico Public Regulation Commission The guy there has not called us back yet Dave PM Louis Soldano Louis Soldano Louis Soldano PM PM To David L NRON Kevin HyattET nron Keith PetersenET NRON cc Subject TW outage please see the attached draft let me know your thgts dave who is the correct state agency

Re TW outageyour request Jan Forwarded by Jan CobdenETSEnron on AM David L Johnson AM To Louis SoldanoETSEnron cc Subject Re TW outage Louie Couple of comments Its the New Mexico Public Regulation Commission The guy there has not called us back yet Dave PM Louis Soldano Louis Soldano Louis Soldano PM PM To David L NRON Kevin HyattET nron Keith PetersenET NRON cc Subject TW outage please see the attached draft let me know your thgts dave who is the correct state agency
Memo re Navajo Cc virginiao attached memo from Lou Soldano

Navajo Statusof this morning we have not yet received a response from the Navajo Nation Also per my follow up conversations with Larry Ruzow after the conference call on Wednesday it appears that at least task force members one council member the Task Force Chairman and the liaison between the Task Force and the Presidents office will not be available for Tuesdays meeting Lou Soldano

The REAL Navajo UpdatI am certain that everyone found the memo regarding the February th meetings in Washington fascinating rereading it was decided that something more topical and relevant should be provided Please see the attached

Navajo Offer Cc virginiao attached documents LSETTLEdoc and TWROWNavajoxls from Lou Soldano Jan Cobden for Lou Soldano Forwarded by Jan CobdenETSEnron on PM lou soldano on PM Please respond to lou soldano To Jan CobdenET NRON cc Subject Navajo Offer atthtm LSETTLEdoc TWROWNavajoxls

Navajo ROW Cc please see the attached tables and graphs I would print out ROWCase and Model The graph is hard to read unless there is a color printer Even then it is much better to review electronically since there are hidden notes that appear when the reader uses the cursor to point to any given data point Id suggest the boss look at the electronic version of the graph while reviewing hard copy of the ROWCase and Model Let me know if he would like to discussLouie Forwarded by Jan CobdenETSEnron on AM James Centilli AM To Louis SoldanoET NRON cc Subject Navajo ROW Please find attached the new worksheet and graph I add the rods to the calculation and made the adjustments per Stans comments Review and let me know if I included everything If you need the graph in color we have a color printer When is the meeting scheduled Thanks James

PGE Meeting Notesis being forwarded for your review in preparation for the pm conference call and just FYI for those not participating in the conference call Forwarded by Jan CobdenETSEnron on AM From John Shafer AM Sent by Kathy Willard To Louis SoldanoET NRON cc John nron Subject PGE Meeting Notes Lou John asked that I send this to you for review and distribution to those who will be participating in the conference call today at pm

FW NMED Compliance OrderCobden Enron Transportation Services Company Smith Street Suite EB Houston TX Fax Original Message From Bill C Scott ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESBillCEScottCwcsmodrallEcomEENR NRONcom Sent Monday June AM To Cc Subject NMED Compliance Order Proprietary Lou I received you phone message and fax I tried to reach Larry Campbell on Friday morning but got his voice mail which indicated he was traveling until Monday I hope to talk with Larry on Monday about this matter You are correct that the legislature amended the Air Act this past session to include a statute of limitations governing enforcement actions That amendment HB provides that no action for civil penalty shall be commenced more than five years from the date the violation was known by the department or local agency to be codified at NMSA Sec The amendment became effective on June the day after the NMED issued the compliance order here NMED doubtless will assert that the limitations period is not applicable here because it was not in effect at the time they initiated the action by filing the Compliance Order Ah what a difference a day makes I will need to take a quick look to evaluate the strength of their position and our position that the limitations period should apply Charlie de Saillan used to be counsel to the New Mexico Natural Resources Trustee He departed from that position nearly a year ago and after short time off went to NMED He and Eric Ames are the two folks handling air issues these days I have dealt with Charlie in the past He is generally pleasant to deal with but not always flexible in his views My sense is that he will want to strike some kind of a deal to resolve this and is not likely to insist on pressing for the full per day for each day of violation From your voice mail message it sounds like NMED was advised of the change out of the engines I will be curious to learn more about what they were told or provided in writing and when I will flesh all that out with Larry when I speak to him I will be out of the office in the morning but will try to catch up with you and Larry as soon as I get in Bill Scott Modrall Sperling Roehl Harris Sisk PA PO Box Albuquerque New Mexico Phone Fax Email Modrall Sperling Roehl Harris Sisk PA THIS MESSAGE IS INTENDED ONLY FOR THE USE OF THE INDIVIDUAL OR ENTITY TO WHICH IT IS ADDRESSED AND MAY CONTAIN INFORMATION THAT IS PRIVILEGED CONFIDENTIAL AND EXEMPT FROM DISCLOSURE UNDER APPLICABLE LAW If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient or agent responsible for delivering the message to the intended recipient you are hereby notified that any dissemination or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited If you have received this electronic transmission in error please delete it from your system without copying it and notify the sender by reply email or by calling so that our address record can be corrected Thank you
Contacts List final versionis the final version of the Contacts List on the Red Rock Project Jan Cobden Enron Transportation Services Company Smith Street Suite EB Houston TX Fax
